reference_summary:
The Dame Edna Experience - The Complete Collection (Series 1/2 & Specials)
Barry Humphries  (Actor),     Emily Perry  (Actor)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, BBC, All BBC Titles
['Ten hours of outright hilarity make up this 5-disc Ednathon,', 'The Dame Edna Experience: The Complete Collection', ". Every program from Dame Edna's hysterical and historical series plus over 4 hours of side-splitting extras make this collection a must-have for Edna's legion of die-hard fans!"]
{'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Box set, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Robin Houston, Charlton Heston, Barry Humphries, Jeffrey Archer, Emily Perry', 'Language': 'Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1)', 'Number Of Discs': '5', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Package Dimensions': '7.7 x 5.5 x 1.9 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'Box set, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC', 'Run time': '10 hours and 4 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 5, 2004', 'Actors': 'Barry Humphries, Emily Perry, Robin Houston, Jeffrey Archer, Charlton Heston', 'Studio': 'BBC Worldwide', 'Number of discs': '5'}
I saw her/him on Graham Norton a while ago. They did a repeat show and I just had to have more. Dame Edna reminds me of the humor we had years ago. She is so quick and witty. You won't be disappointed to get these collections - they are gold....
WONDERFULLY HYSTERICAL !!!!!
1408 (Two-Disc Collector's Edition)
John Cusack  (Actor)    Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Horror
['(Thriller) Based on a short story by Stephen King, a man who specializes in debunking the paranormal checks into the infamous room 1408 in the Dolphin Hotel, only to discover\x85 the terror is real.']
{'Genre': 'Thriller', 'Format': "Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Collector's Edition, Widescreen", 'Contributor': 'John Cusack', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 44 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Media Format': "Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC, Collector's Edition, Widescreen", 'Run time': '1 hour and 44 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 2, 2007', 'Actors': 'John Cusack', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '2'}
What's not to like??? Another great Stephen King movie with great actors like John Cusack and Samuel L Jackson. Stephen's movies are always so fascinating, his plots rarely cease to amaze me. Always something different, he thinks outside of the box.
LUV IT.....
TCM Greatest Classic Films Collection: Comedy (Arsenic and Old Lace / A Night at the Opera / The Long Long Trailer / Father of the Bride 1950)
Cary Grant  (Actor),     Marx Brothers  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Today's Deals, Spotlight Deals, Mother's Day Gift Ideas in Movies & TV
['TCM Greatest Classic Films: Comedy (4FE) (DVD)', 'ARSENIC AND OLD LACE Cary Grant and a stellar cast romp through this classic farce based on the Broadway hit and breezily directed by Frank Capra. A frazzled drama critic’s two maiden aunts put a secret ingredient in their elderberry wine – and the resulting circus is howlingly hilarious, with a comically rubber-faced, rubber-legged Grant in the center ring. A NIGHT AT THE OPERA Grand opera equals grand comedy as the Marx Brothers cram a ship’s stateroom and more with wall-to-wall gags, one-liners, musical riffs and two hard-boiled eggs – all while skewering pompous schemes to sabotage an opera production. “Arguably their finest film” (4 Star Rating! - Leonard Maltin’s Movie Guide). THE LONG, LONG TRAILER Anyone know how to park this thing? Lucille Ball and Desi Arnaz play newlyweds who hit the honeymoon road with a 40-foot house trailer in tow in this slaphappily-ever-after comedy directed by Vincente Minnelli. FATHER OF THE BRIDE (1950) Spencer Tracy is the father and Elizabeth Taylor the bride in this comic celebration of an American rite (and wrongs) of passage. Here comes the bride, there goes dad’s wallet…and everyone’s heart. What sparkling fun!', ']]>']
{'Genre': 'Classics, Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Full Screen, Black & White, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Contributor': 'Spencer Tracy, Marx Brothers, Cary Grant, Desi Arnaz, Elizabeth Taylor, Lucille Ball', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 1.0), Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1)', 'Runtime': '6 hours and 46 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': '400649', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Full Screen, Black & White, Subtitled, NTSC', 'Run time': '6 hours and 46 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 3, 2009', 'Actors': 'Cary Grant, Marx Brothers, Lucille Ball, Desi Arnaz, Spencer Tracy', 'Subtitles': 'English, French', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Number of discs': '4'}
It's nice to be able to get a copy of these oldies but goodies. They just don't make them like they used to.
Great old movies

I should have looked closer, not just the title. This is the original movie, I wanted the remake, oh well :(
Wrong movie
Alien Quadrilogy (Alien / Aliens / Alien 3 / Alien Resurrection)
Sigourney Weaver  (Actor),     Tom Skerritt  (Actor),     David Fincher  (Director),     James Cameron  (Director, Writer)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, Science Fiction, General
['Product Description', 'Includes "Alien," "Aliens," "Alien 3," and "Alien: Resurrection."', 'Amazon.com', 'The', 'Alien Quadrilogy', 'is a nine-disc boxed set devoted to the four', 'Alien', 'films. Although previously available on DVD as the', 'Alien Legacy', ', here they have been repackaged with vastly more extras and with upgraded sound and picture. For anyone who hasn\'t been in hypersleep for the last 25 years, this series needs no introduction, though for the first time each film now comes in both original and "special edition" form.', 'Alien', "(1979) was so perfect it didn't need fixing, and Ridley Scott's 2003 director's cut is fiddling for the sake of fiddling. Watch it once, then return to the majestic, perfectly paced original. Conversely, the special edition of James Cameron's", 'Aliens', "(1986) is the definitive version, though it's nice to finally have the theatrical cut on DVD for comparison. Most interesting is the alternative", 'Alien 3', '(1992). This isn\'t a "director\'s cut"--David Fincher refused to have any involvement with this release--but a 1991 work-print that runs 29 minutes longer than the theatrical version, and has now been restored, remastered, and finished off with (unfortunately) cheap new CGI. Still, it\'s truly fascinating, offering a different insight into a flawed masterpiece. The expanded opening is visually breathtaking, the central firestorm is much longer, and a subplot involving Paul McGann\'s character adds considerable depth to story. The ending is also subtly but significantly different.', 'Alien: Resurrection', '(1997) always was a mess with a handful of brilliant scenes, and the special edition just makes it eight minutes longer.', 'The', 'Alien Quadrilogy', 'offers the first and fourth films with DTS soundtracks, the others having still fine Dolby Digital 5.1 presentation. All four films sound fantastic, with much low-level detail revealed for the first time. Each is anamorphically enhanced at the correct original aspect ratio, and the prints and transfers are superlative. Every film offers a commentary track that lends insight into the creative process--though the Scott-only commentary and isolated music score from the first', 'Alien', 'DVD release are missing here.', 'Each movie is complemented by a separate disc packed with hours of seriously detailed documentaries (all presented in full-screen with clips letterboxed), thousands of photos, production stills, and storyboards, giving a level of inside information for the dedicated buff only surpassed by the', 'Lord of the Rings', 'extended DVD sets. A ninth DVD compiles miscellaneous material, including an hourlong documentary and even all the extras from the old', 'Alien', 'laserdisc. "Exhaustive" hardly beings to describe the', 'Alien Quadrilogy', ', a set that establishes the new DVD benchmark for retrospective releases and looks unlikely to be surpassed for some time.', '--Gary S. Dalkin']

Brady Bunch: Season 2
Barry Williams  (Actor),     Christopher Knight  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Paramount Home Entertainment, Boxed Sets
["Here's the story of America's grooviest TV sitcom family! It's the story of THE BRADY BUNCH and in SEASON TWO of this best-loved comedy series there are plenty of high jinks underfoot in split-level suburbia. Greg? He's got a far-out bachelor pad to impress all the chicks. Marcia? She's embracing Women's Lib. Peter? He's headed for the doghouse after breaking Carol's favorite vase. Jan? She's gone from hair of gold to hair of black - via a brand-new wig. Bobby's pet parakeet may help him overcome his fear of heights, and Cindy's plagued by a schoolyard bully who's been making fun of her lisp. On the adult front, Mike's architectural firm plans to build right on top of a beloved neighborhood park, Carol tries her creative hand at writing for a women's magazine and Alice the housekeeper has called the exterminator on Myron - Greg's science project!"]

Brady Bunch: Season 1
Ann B. Davis  (Actor),     Christopher Knight  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Paramount Home Entertainment, Comedy
["Here's the story of America's grooviest TV sitcom family! In this premiere season of one of America's best-loved comedy series, architect Mike Brady (Robert Reed) is a widower with three sons - Greg (Barry Williams), Peter (Christopher Knight) and Bobby (Mike Lookinland). He meets a similarly single parent, Carol Ann Tyler Martin (Florence Henderson), who has three daughters of her own: Marcia (Maureen McCormick), Jan (Eve Plumb) and Cindy (Susan Olsen). When Mike and Carol decide to marry, the combination of two parents, six kids, one dog (Tiger), and a feisty housekeeper (Ann B. Davis) leads to love, laughter - and a whole lot of chaos. It's the way they all became THE BRADY BUNCH!"]

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests:** The user showcases a sustained appreciation for classic comedy while increasingly favoring distinctive psychological thrillers that feature bizarre and unpredictable narratives. Their passion for storytelling is complemented by a keen interest in deep character development.

- **Content Preference:** They actively seek out episodic series and collector's editions that blend nostalgia with high-quality craftsmanship, reinforcing their appreciation for well-crafted narratives.

- **Nostalgia Factor:** The user values retro content that elicits sentimentality and durability, enjoying humor alongside traditional storytelling.

- **Engagement with Media:** They maintain a clear preference for physical media formats, cherishing tangible collections that enhance immersive experiences and foster meaningful interactions.

- **Rating Behavior:** The user consistently demonstrates discerning taste through high ratings, with their latest review reflecting satisfaction and enjoyment of innovative content. The recent 5.0 rating highlights their open-mindedness towards new narratives while retaining their high standards.

- **Influences:** Their selections are heavily driven by high-caliber acting and thematic richness, ensuring continuous satisfaction with their entertainment choices.

- **Community Connection:** The user thrives in communities of like-minded fans, celebrating the golden age of cinema and exploring diverse genres.

- **Recent Engagement:** The latest interaction emphasizes their excitement for engaging content, particularly innovative stories, while aligning with their established preferences for narratives that provoke thought and entertainment.
